reviews.sentence: Nice stop along the way. The chatanogan has apparently been newly renovated and is quite comfortable with really spacious rooms. Centrally located and if you are a craft beer fan you can walk a few blocks and have some delightfully delicious beer and food in a historic train hotel. Also good coffee in nearby cafes. Liked the coffee and quick breakfast at Mean Mug.

Great hotel for the money. The hotel is located off of the main streets of downtown Chattanooga however it is only a couple of blocks from all of the activity. Easy walk to restaurants shopping entertainment Warehouse Row. Hotel restaurants have Happy Hour drink cocktail specials and the food that we tried was very good. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

Great Hotel. I had an excellent stay here. it is a very new hotel with beautiful grounds in a great location. I would recommend it especially to anyone coming in for convention center events. The breakfast buffet was really solid and the front desk staff was helpful and welcoming.

Comfortable Rooms Great Service. I stayed here for a few days for a business trip. It was not the cheapest place in town but it was worth every penny. Loved the comfortable bed good location and very helpful staff. My stay included free breakfast their breakfast buffet was definitely a step up from most buffets. Once I ran downstairs just as the buffet window time was closing and they said I could just order off the menu since they were putting the food away. I highly recommend this place and if I am ever back in Chattanooga for work or fun I plan on staying here.

This is one of the best hotel stays we have ever had anywhere. The rooms were nice and very clean. Every staff member we encountered was beyond friendly. The lobby is warm and inviting. The fire pit is an excellent touch. The bar and restaurant were fantastic. I do have to recognize Josh at the front desk who has to be the most friendly and accommodating person ever. He made us feel very welcome. You definitely have a gem with him. Also Melvin makes great grits and an outstanding omelet. Our compliments to the chef for a delicious breakfast. We were truly satisfied with everyones hospitality.
Great atmosphere and a fire pit. Short business stop. This hotel was warm welcoming and was well appointed. Nice bar restaurants and a fire pit sitting area.
Good place for a conference. Nice meeting rooms good A V great food. This hotel is walking distance to much of downtown and it is many dining choices. I have stayed here several times.
Beautiful and comfortable Hotel but somewhat of a walk from restaurants and attractions. You have to pay an additional 8 per day to park in a city lot.
Exceptional. Friendly courteous staff. Great food in restaurant.

Very Underwhelming. It seems like I am an outlier in saying this but this hotel just was not very impressive. The lobby is kind of cool but the rooms are underwhelming considering the price that was paid to stay the night here. For instance the are on the wall looks like it was pulled from a 80s movie and it clashes with anything else in the room. Every single lamp in the room has something wrong with it whether it be a missing switch rust or a bulb that looks like it is about to go out. The TV is set weirdly high from the bed for viewing and is pretty small for the overall room. In room dining was OK. Honestly it seemed more like Cisco truck food than farm to table style grub that this country is getting used too. Again though the room service staff is amazing. The positive is the bed was comfortable and the toiletries were of high quality and the coffee station was decent Keurig. The service is incredibly friendly and that can not be overlooked. So I would say that if you can book this place in the 100 range it is fine. The nightly rate I had made it far from OK especially because I really love a unique hotel experience.

The hotel is very good. Self Parking is free but breakfast is not free. The view from the hotel is not very good. There are other equivalent that are closer to the river. Overall we had a good time at both The Chatanogan and the city of Chattanooga.

Very romantic anniversary spot. We were greeted by Melvin at the front desk. He was warm and very personable. He went above and beyond to ensure we had e everything we needed. The hotel is beautiful clean and sprawling. We got to our room and it was very nice. However I did not pay attention to what kind of room I booked and we ended up with two double beds. That was n’t going to suit us comfortably so I called down to see if there were any king rooms available still. Marvin and the night mgr Bre were so super nice and acomodating. They immediately checked and determined there were and moved us. We did n’t even have to go downstairs you can electronically change your key in the elevator. I have never seen that before. We easily did that and moved rooms. This room was perfect with a beautiful view. We enjoyed an evening drink at the bar downstairs and sitting at the fire pit. We went down and had a fantastic breakfast. After breakfast we played shuffle board and had a lot of fun doing so. I loved that the checkout time was 12 pm Bc we did n’t have to feel rushed. Just all around great job1. In a hotel this large noise is n’t an issue so why not have no pool hours or late night adult swim until 12 am or even 2 am. ❤ ️2. The fire pit area is so pretty but more comfortable seating around it would be awesome3. The pool table darts and shuffle board table are very hidden and not labeled we sat at the bar and still had no idea they were there. We found them by total accident the next morning3. The parking deck is a long way from the hotel and the front desk is even farther. A shuttle golf cart or something would be a nice touch4. Since you all are in chatanoga but a little too far for walking distance from Main Street a shuttle would be greatThese are personal opinion not complains. I loved it and our stay. I have stayed here before and it never disappoints. Great Job.

Very friendly and helpful staff from the valet parking baggage handling and front desk personnel. Later when we needed recommendations for dinner or directions the front desk staff were spot on in their recommendations. We LOVED the Southern Star restaurant nearby and Rembrandts Coffee House up near the Aquarium both were good steers. Rooms were pristine and we enjoyed relaxing on the outdoor patio beside the spa.

This was my 2nd visit to this hotel. 1st visit was great. On this visit the hotel looked very rundown. I would have expected the local microtel to look as the Chatanogan did. Did not have ANY type of breakfast available Will stay somewhere else on next visit.

The room was nice. However the room had dirty dishes in the drawer for who knows how long. We went to the bistro for brunch and the clean dishes were dirty. Old food still on them. I understand they have been bought out but come on now. For the price we paid especially for New Years Eve I expected more attention to detail.

Stay at the Chattanooga hotel. The cs people are great. Breakfast was not so great which I was explained about the buffet. Front desk sold me tickets not knowing there was not breakfast buffet that day. But everything else was ok.
Exceptional. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Would definitely come backBreakfast was pricey for the amount of fodCould offer a children ’s menu.

Horrible Room Service. Breakfast room service came in a to go bag. Egg in a high sided box flat and looked like a frisbee sausage wrapoed in paper. Toast in plastic wrap and wet from the steam. I threw the whole thing in the trash. Unbelievable that an otherwise really nice hotel would think room service should be served that way.

We stayed here one night and it was an ok experience. Not really worth the price point. The staff for the most part was helpful and welcoming but our experience at The Foundry was not the best. I had recommend going somewhere else. We ultimately ended up packing our food to go and eating in the room. Our server seemed bothered that we were there and was a bit aggressive. We noticed another server treating the one other person in the restaurant in about the same manner so I guess that is just how they do things. Do them and yourself a favor and go somewhere else for dinner they seem like they do not want to work anyway and you can do better for your money. The breakfast buffet is not worth it either and should honestly be complementary considering the quality of it. you are better off finding somewhere else in the city. We also were told in booking that the room we got would include a welcome beer wine and we did not receive that. Save a few bucks and get a hotel or airbnb elsewhere.

was not great kinda bummed. The guys at valet were awesome and very apologetic. Even though our truck was not ever pulled around in the time we said when we went out there they were very quick to retrieve it. Alexis the night we checked in was awesome and super friendly. The hotel was very clean bathrooms in the lobby were great and the atmosphere of the restaurant. The pool did not work the hot tub was out. it would take 20 30 minutes for the water to heat up for a shower they said it was a pressure issue. the cleaning lady walked in our room even though we said just a minute bc we were getting dressed the staff at the desk were not very friendly we went to the bar in the hotel Friday night and were over charged by 70 on drinks we did nt get but did nt notice it until the next morning so nothing could be done the phone had a short in the cord so when we would call the front desk they could only hear pieces of what we were saying or asking for.
